text: Good service good food. Was really quick on delivery after order and staff was super friendly. Quick access on the street and lots of parking.

I remember my step dad bringing me here when my little brother was only three, that was 10 years ago.
I have been wanting to go back for such a long time and today I finally got to take my kids and husband to this shadowed gem hiding in plain sight. My husband is so picky with where to eat but being that we both like the 50s era I knew he would appreciate the ambiance, music and feel.
He ordered the two egg special with hash browns and bacon. He had such rave reviews all he could do was look at me with a cheeky smile after each bite. I knew with or without me this is a place he would come back to. He had coffee the whole time and let me mind you that he isn't an avid coffee drinker. He LOVED it. He had three cups.
I had the large meatlovers omelet with spuds and the pumpkin nut bread-most Devine thing ever- It was soooo yummy. I was a fourth of the way done but couldn't do it. I was upset that I couldn't finish that goodness lol.
Our 5 year-old had the 2 pancake special and our waitress recommended the sweet cream batter. I took one bite.. Died and went to heaven.
Everything just had that great home cooked feel.
We ate at 9am and it's 2pm now and I am still full.

All of our taste buds went on an adventure today and we couldn't be happier. I am in strong belief every Thursday on my husband's  day off.. that this will be our breakfast joint. Service was spectacular, everyone was friendly and awesome. We were definitely satisfied.

This diner is consistent and has been growing as a neighborhood restaraunt. I feel at home when I walk in and see the same friendly faces. It is a multicultural bilingual environment that is accepting of every person who comes in to dine. The food is AMZING and mouth watering each time you sit down and have a meal. It will always be my breakfast hot spot!

Cute atmosphere and the most amazing menu of omelets that I've ever seen (over 40 types, plus an option to create your own!). Well-cooked omelets, nice staff and a good price ($6 for a 6-egg, loaded omelet). Highly recommended!
Stopped by twice on our 4 days in Vegas. Good food and great friendly service. Accepted restaurant.com gift cards without a fuss!

This place is amazing! It's an 'Omelet House' but better then the one on Charleston! The sweet cream pancakes are to die for! My friend and I ordered two small omelets which were fantastic. The Mexican is fantastic as is the Popeye. Don't forget small Omelet is 3 eggs and large is 6!! You have to be hungry for a large or split it! The manager is awesome and attentive. Defiantly a place to try if you have a car and are visiting vegas.
Absolutely amazing. Worth leaving the strip for. Milkshakes are some of the best i ever had. That alone is worth the trip

Best Coffee, Amazing Pumpking Bread. Servers attentive and refill coffee. Every type of Omelet you can think of, and Most flavorful sausage ever. Atmosphere is calm and pictures of Marilyn Menroe everywhere.  If you dont want to wait for breakfast like other popular diners, then come here. You wont regret it, definitely a gold mine.

I'm not sure why this place has 4 stars it should have 5! It seems like the people who don't like it ordered dinner which I've never tried so I can't comment on that.. But as far as breakfast goes this is my favorite breakfast place EVER! The Mexican omelette is so good it is a definite must try if u come here! I know the name is "50s diner" but it also says Omlette House on the outside which is their speciality so i would recommend ordering one! I've tried a few others that were all amazing! The coffee is great! I usually get 5 refills on it and I've never had bad service! One time
my pancakes were cold so they made me new ones within a minute! They're very accommodating and the whole vibe is cute and retro!! And it is "seat ur self" for the people confused about coming in.

Today was my first time coming to the 50s Diner and it was excellent. I ordered the Large Petunia Pig Omelet and was blown away by the huge portions. It was probably one of the best things I have ever eaten for breakfast. With it, I got the pumpkin nut bread which was very delicious. The 50s diner is one of the better places to come and eat in Las Vegas.
Food and service was great... Decore could of been better, just appeared to be a bunch of things thrown together but what's most important is food and service. So I'll give it a 5 star.
This place by FAR is WAY better than any other diners in town (cocos ihop dennys blue berry hill).has NOTHING on this 50's diner!

Didn't like it,  food is plain and boring nothing special about this place.  I make a better breakfast/lunch at home! Service was ok we were the only ones in there.
Most likely not going back.
Great food. Big menu with lots of omelette options. 50s diner atmosphere. Very clean with great service. Loved supporting this small, family owned local business.
No wait!  Clean, quick, and friendly service. Delicious French Toast Special, Lil Chickadee omelet, and Bacon cheeseburger. Affordable prices and comfy environment.

Great atmosphere, great food, good prices! Comparable to Barnies Beanery or Mels Drive In if you're from LA. Locals place definitely and a gem find for tourists. They have a counter to sit at as well which is great for one person diners!

So in love with this place. It is a family owned gem with fantastic food. I love, love, love their breakfast, everything you love about a good down home breakfast, DELICIOUS! Lunch time, I recommend the French Dip but in all honesty, every sandwich I've had here is crazy good. The staff is always courteous and polite. AND the owners, I cannot say enough good things about this family, they are a hard working, fun group and will remember you by name!  If I could give them more stars I would do so happily.

Been coming here for 28 years and I lived it BUT whomever bought this place over a few years ago or whomever runs it now has changed it for the worst....it's dirty, they can't get an order right (more than once) and more than likely your stomach will hurt after you eat...

Small place but clean.  Service was good and our waitress was very friendly and attentive. Food came out quickly and was decent. I had the pancake combo with the sweet cream pancake.  The spuds are basically fresh potato chips which was different. The area around the restaurant was a little sketch.  Transients all over the place.
Great diner food....easy access....friendly staff.....i highly recommend. IHOP and Dennys are garbage by comparison
After a log weekend on the strip this place rocks! Super good breakfast even the root beer was perfect. If you lost all your money in the hype of vegas this is a good place to feel better 'bout it.

Great service.
Nominal flavor, portions. Chicken fried steak is bland.
Scramble $5.99 is tiny. Don't get the home made potato chips. They're good but  for breakfast? Weird.
This is one of my favorite breakfast places we go on Sunday's all the food is delicious can't go wrong here and waitress are very nice as well

just an amazing place to eat with the family. 
the burgers were oh so good and the shakes were amazing. the service was great too.
If a pic says 1000 words then I have submitted several thousand. Pics explain everything. Received superfast service while sitting on the barstools. Excellente!

Sorry, but upon entering the premises, I was not impressed at all. I thought it was a run down place but seeing they were busy with customers, so let's inhale first. I was hesitant to order coz I don't feel like the place is clean. The window glass with screen attached was dirty along the peeled paint. The decor even though it's vintage, they could have at least find something to revamp. Anyways, to make it short,  I can call it DD. Food taste... I liked my french toast special but my husband omelette with meat, he ate half of it only and said doesn't taste good. Oh boy, I don't feel like writing this and offend the owners but  it is what it is.

The pumpkin nut bread, as a toast option, is worth 5 stars by itself. We had the healthy vege omelette and the spinach shrimp omelette, both were very good. The "small" omelettes are 3 eggs and more than enough for us. I don't know who would be able to eat the large 6 egg omelettes. The spuds are fresh cut potatoes, kind of like large potato chips, and seem more suited for their sandwiches instead of the omelettes. They do have the option to upgrade to hash browns for a little extra. The prices are more than what is posted on this site, but in line with what you would expect them to be. Will definitely come back regularly.
Dont understand the rating food was very average.  Diner itself could use a good cleaning!

We got here around 7pm ...my hubby order tilapia with mash potatoe and gravy as well as spicy beef soup he really injoyed it... I got a chicken fried steak with garvy , mash potatoes , and fries ...I injoyed it but iwont be ordering the fried steak not my cup of tea to be honest I just felt like trying it once...the sweat cream pancake was good dont notice a difference from the regular only more fluffy... I hope to go again in the moring to give it a different review on different foods

Darn good diner. Some places try to be something they're not; like a truck stop trying to serve good French cuisine. It could happen, but it's probably rare. This place, however, says it's a diner, serves diner food, and does a very good job. 
It opened promptly at 7am, and the place was ready to go (we've been to two places that when I've commented on the substandard early morning service, the owners wrote to me and said the staff was still setting up. I think a restaurant should be ready to serve at the time they open).  The service was very quick and pleasant. 
I had bacon, eggs, hash browns and an english muffin. My husband had a sweet cream pancake on a previous visit, this time he had the Portuguese omelette with spuds. We also shared an order of pumpkin bread.
The pumpkin bread was very good, my hash browns were perfect, bacon was great - the server asked if I wanted it crispy; it's nice that she asked- and the eggs were just the way I like them. 
My husband's omelette was tasty, the spuds were like soft potato chips and very good. The last time he got the pancake, he liked it. 
Overall, great diner food, friendly & fast service, the kitchen seemed to be well run, and comfortable setting. If I lived closer, I'd be a regular. 
Recommended.

Place looks cheap & cheesy - would not have a first date here with Cindy Crawford - BUT this is the friendliest place to eat in LV.  Great food and a real 50's atmosphere (I remember the 50's).  I travel and eat out a lot.  Recommend this place without reservation.
You have to try this place. The meals are always scrumptious. The service can be a hit or miss at times but I always come back.

Continuing our search for breakfast restaurants we went here based or high marks on Yelp.  It did not disappoint.  Since this is the Omelet House we, of course, had to have omelets.  Being gluten intolerant I must avoid all the wheat based goodies like pancakes and waffles. providing a double reason for having an omelet.  With a name like "Porky Pig Omelet" my omelet sounded like something that should be condemned by the AMA, but it was delicious.  My wife had a build your own from what is the most extensive omelet menus I have ever seen.  What they call "spuds" came with it and are actually very thin fried potatoes; which were excellent.  

They also lived up to the 50s Diner name with nostalgic photos and period paraphernalia decor. It was a bit noisy, but not so much as to spoil the experience.  And fortunately, it was not crowded and we were seated and attended to immediately.  It was laid out like a 50s diner so although it was open seating we didn't feel like we were crowded in with people we didn't know like some of the more popular places we have gone to.

Only came here cuz we had a restaurant.com coupon. Bases upon reviews from Yelp we decided to give it a try. 

Nice, friendly service. Fast in getting our food out. And it was correct on the first attempt! Which in my opinion is hard to find these! Haha

Clean restaurant. And the coffee is really good. Will definitely be back on our next visit to Vegas!

This place was amazing! I had the "Plymouth Rock" omelet with turkey, avocado, and jack cheese. For a dollar more, a 3 egg omelet becomes a 6 egg omelet. Delicious and great value. Pumpkin but bread was something special. Will be back!

The food was decent, service was inconsistent. I got the mexicali omelette and it was good, though it came with "home fries" which turns out to be chips... Some crispy and some soggy in between. In fact I didn't even know they had hash browns until I found some in between some chips. The pumpkin bread was okay, though it was rubbery because they microwave it before they being it to you. I wouldn't come back, there are better places in the price range for breakfast.

I'll start from beginning to end  you walk in no one greets u I didn't know whether to sit or wait to be seated so I asked and she said sit anywhere the menu didn't have too much variety so I got chicken fingers with fries and a drink which was 10.79 not bad and the food was made to order and it was pretty good nothing special
This place is affordable and the portions are big! The service is friendly and fast! I would go back anytime!

It's not a fancy place and a bit dirty; however, I still liked it. I had the biscuits and gravy and pumpkin bread. They were both good. The biscuits and gravy came with bacon and sausage (I requested both) and these unusual homemade potato chips (first for me). My waitress was really good and they always kept my coffee cup full. If only they could clean up a bit and be more attentive to people coming in. I waited a while for someone to get a seat, but then eventually was told I could pick a seat. For my first time, I wouldn't have known that and just stood waiting for a while.
The price is right and the food is just as good!!!  Its your ma and pa restaurant!

This place is so underestimated. I've been here before for lunch and ordered their turkey club sandwich (amazing!). I thought I would try them out for breakfast as a reward to myself after completing a college final.

I ordered an omelette, which is what they're known for, called the Polack (3 eggs, sliced polish sausage and cheddar cheese) with a side of hashbrowns and sourdough toast (REAL SOURDOUGH!!). I have no doubt I will be coming back for breakfast again because my choice was absolutely delicious.

I ate here for the first time today. I work in the area and was tired of trying the same places. The place was busy, but the service was great, friendly and timely. The food came out in a timely manner and everyone enjoyed!

The place could definitely use a good scrubbing.  I went in around noon and the place was pretty busy.  It is in an ugly strip mall and not very visible.   Would have liked to sit at the counter (it's a diner, right?) but the counter was muddles up with waitress side work items (pitchers of salt, sugar packets, etc.) and I kid you not.. a book exchange.(Seriously??)  The service was fast, I opted for the hash browns instead of the seasoned potato chip type "spuds" and they were cold.  The sausage patty and egg were fine... nothing great.  Would not go out of my way to return, the place is too cluttered and dirty
Good food, friendly staff. Good prices. Had a restaurant.com certificate. They were more than happy to redeem. I would recommend.

If I could give this place a zero I would ...I ordered the biscuits and gravy and it was awful so I sent it back ..my husband ordered the western burger with no cheese and of course they screwed that up so he sent it back for them to did it ..by the time he finally got his food everyone was done eating ..the burger was soggy and gross...the service sucked and we still had to pay for the food we sent back ...I would recommend this place to anyone !!!
This is one of our favorite places to frequent. The staff is outstanding and the food is better.

Love this place for breakfast. They have the winning recipe--friendly staff, tasty food, & good value. Yes, you will want to come back. I can say that you will find the best hash browns in town @ this diner. You will see that there is a regular crowd that all speak well of this nostalgic little 50's diner. A great go to place. Dennis D.

The food is good.  Do Not go to the East Desert Inn location.   My husband and I were assaulted by another customer.  I asked our waitress 3 times to call the police and she totally ignored us.  Things esculated and we were attack verbally and physically by another customer.  Waitress did absolutely Nothing!!  Not a safe environment for going out to eat.  Go to another location...bad area of town.
Wanted a simple diner experience where the locals go and go just that. Excellent food, service was exceptional, and the pumpkin spice bread was the best! Give it a try.

The diner is set up as a 50s diner with 50s music playing in the background.Service was good,very friendly waitresses. They have different types of omelets. I ordered the Mexicano omelet. The omelet was good, just wasn't a big fan of the spicy bacon.
Love it here ! Went here with my family and they gave us such great service ,very friendly staff and great food .

*GREAT MEAL FOR A GREAT PRICE* 

Looking for your next breakfast stop? Well look no more!

50's Breakfast specials are my go to! Most specials come with the omelet house's signature spuds. These homemade French fries will have any potato lover craving more!

Love this place. Its a must every time I come to Vegas to work which is about 8-10 times a year. Cute atmosphere. The staff tends to you since it doesn't get extremely packed like a dennys or Ihop, which those places are too commercial for me anyways. I like little mom and pop places like this. Food is great, and they're on top of the coffee which is awesome for a coffee addict like me. Def a must try if in Vegas, a little out of the way if youre staying close to the strip, but if youre like me and dont like to go anywhere near the strip and stay off the strip i recommend this place.
We found this little gem thanks to help. The food was great and plentiful. Would definitely recommend it.

Love the 50's theme. A lot of cool photos hanging on the walls of Hollywood Icons like Marilyn Monroe, Elvis Presley, and James Dean. There's also photos of the Rat Pack. As far as cleanliness goes, I give them  a F. The floor is very dirty. I can easily see food particle, dirt and rocks on the floor. Looks like they don't mop too often.The location is in the tougher side of town. Now let's get to the food. My guy ordered their ham, eggs and chips special. The chips were burnt and a little hard. Eggs were cooked perfectly and ham was a little dry.

The fact that you can order small omelettes and build your own made my shrimp, cheddar, onion, green pepper, sour cream omelette fantastic! Hash browns, coffee, bacon cooked PERFECT and cranberry juice Awesome made it more fantastic! Not every place in Vegas can get breakfast right but this place did!! And have Elvis & Priscilla Wedding Photos on the wall! PERFECT!!!!

I like this place, there menu selection is ample and they even have a interesting delicacy Liver  with Caramelized Unions. I tried it and it was good. Prices are affordable for any budget. I suggest the strawberry milkshake with a Burger, I mean Yummers. The wait staff is friendly and the food comes out relatively quick.

Went here for brunch. Awesome place. I had the 2 pancake special that come with eggs or a choice of 2 pieces of bacon or 1 sausage. They have specials daily. Service was great by the guy that took our orders. This place is a must when in Vegas. We will be back.

Stumbled across this place while googling places to eat. We decided to take a chance and weren't disappointed! I had a club sandwich and my wife had the chicken strips. Everything was absolutely delicious and perfectly prepared. Usually when I get a club sandwich I end up wearing half of it because the sandwich falls apart on me. Not this one! The cook did a fantastic job putting it together. Not to mention my wife's chicken strips were perfectly crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. Didn't even need ranch (although their ranch WAS delicious!). I loved the decorations and the music was so good! Nothing goes better with a club sandwich than some Buddy Holly and Roy Orbison

Espectacular si venís a las Vegas tenéis que venir la comida excelente los espaguetis con albóndigas los sándwiches ,las ensaladas elaboradas al momento y tienes que probar las tortillas el precio increíble y muy buena calidad.

My hubby and I absolutely *LOVE* this place! The food is delish, the portions are bigger than most (so make sure you come with an appetite) and the staff is friendly!  The whole feel of the place is so vintage- and 50's (literally!).  The price isn't bad either!  Overall, a great place to have breakfast or brunch.
This Diner has GREAT customer service, the food is AMAZING ! Highly recommend this place

I really can't believe we just now stumbled on this place after being in the valley for a quite some time. This place has a great 50s feel to it and is very welcoming.  The owners daughter was our wonderful server and her husband the genius cook.  

We came in an hour before closing and there was only one other couple so I'm assuming the rush was over but I'm sure this place gets packed earlier on.  We ordered lunch and breakfast.  We ordered the California Sandwich which consisted of grilled chicken breast, lettuce/tomato, mayo, jack cheese, avocado and jalapeno bacon on toasted sourdough bread accompanied by homemade kettle chips which they call spuds. Since it was our first time here without even asking us our server had the some of the spuds cooked crispy and soft so we could decide for ourselves on our favorite cooking style...wow! I really appreciated her doing this and for the record my favorite spuds are the crispy ones but my husband liked the soft one so now we know for next time to ask for half-n-half.  
 
We also ordered their pancake breakfast which comes with a short stack, 2 eggs any style, and sausage or bacon.  You have the choice of buttermilk or cream pancakes.  So we went with the highly recommended cream pancakes.  And we were not disappointed. They are good old fashion pancakes with a hint of sweetness and just marvelous!  And since there is always room for dessert we shared apple pie with a scoop of vanilla ice cream...yumm !  

There menu is very extensive so we can't wait to come back and try some of their other menu items!
Excelent service.  Veronica our waitress was extremely polite and helpful in choosing  the right omelet.  You cant leave with out  trying the pumkin bread.

This is a perfect greasy spoon diner. The service is great and the coffee flows freely. We have been going here every time we visit Vegas for the last few years.

Special things not to miss include the jalapeño bacon, pumpkin bread (an alternate to toast), and the stuffed French toast.

50s Diner serving the classic diner food was packed!  It had the whole Elvis/Happy Days vibe going on but the pink does start to get to you after a while.  At least its fun to peruse the different decorations hanging everywhere.

Sweet cream pancakes - I had high expectations for this for some reason.  And of course it wasn't met.  Maybe it was the cream but these fell flat.  (sad face) Still, you need the carbs to offset the bacon and egg breakfast trifecta.

Unnamed Omelette - once again, an omelette so mediocre, I forgot the name.  I do remember it was quite large and the ingredients were fresh but don't expect it to blow your socks off.  It's a good gut buster to get you through the day.

Service came with a smile and the customers were super friendly too.  Older couple gave up their booth for us since we were with 2 kids.  Travelling away from the strip...you tend to meet the friendlier locals who'll do that for you.
Food was surprisingly good. Flavored sodas were amazing! I don't often make it to the east side of town, but this place is one more reason to try to!

I thought this place was called 50's Diner..anyhow a local suggested this place to us and we had a burger & fries...pretty good i must say...kinda tasted like in n out burger but alot bigger and thicker..also had the french dip which was also tasty..

I chose to try this restaurant, we have a sick kitten and have been in the Desert Inn Animal hospital several times this week and so I said, lets go have breakfast!

Dicing of course!

The die made me get the french toast combo which comes with 4 slices of french toast and 2 eggs, a sausage patty and I ordered corned beef hash on the side.

My Ex had to order hot chocolate which he said was good and he ordered steak and eggs and the steak was cooked to perfection and seasoned very nicely, Not a HUGE portion but delicious.

The french toast was soft and creamy texture, it was cooked, it just tasted cooked with extra love and the hash was grilled I believe as it had that grilled taste, awesome and we ordered a side of ham for the dog and each tried a bite. You have to test the merchandise ya know and it was yummy too.

Service was spot on, The restaurant was clean and CROWDED which is always a good sign, Prices were out of this world GOOD.   

The only negative I would say is that when you walk in, there is no sign that tells you to seat yourself or to wait to be seated so if you have never been to this location as we had not, you wont know what to do, we stood there for a minute and then I asked a customer and he said, Yeah seat yourself.

:)     There needs to be a sign but we will be back!!!

Die willing.

The wait staff was excellent and deserves to be recognized. Their attentiveness and overall demeanor was truly standout worthy. When we came in, the place was pretty busy but we were seated, placed our orders, and had hot food to our table in less than 10 minutes. The portions were very substantial and the prices were very reasonable. Definitely will come back the next time I'm in the area.

I had the Health Nut Omelette and it was good!  

Food was delivered in what felt like 5 minutes. Service was friendly. Restaurant was clean. 

Most importantly, the music was wonderful! Hehe!  Singing along to all these classic songs really made me enjoy my visit a bit more! I'm a sucker for 50's music. 

Anyways, it's worth a visit! Enjoy!

It was a little hard to find because there wasn't a sign on the front of the building. I ended up driving past it and saw the sign on the back side of the building.

I bought the BBC Omelet (Bacon, Broccoli, & Cheese) which came served with potato slices and two pieces of toast. The small should be sufficient for someone looking for breakfast and the large would probably be best for a filling meal.

The omelet looked cheap but was very satisfying in flavor. No complaints.
The potato slices were a little overcooked but didn't give off a burnt flavor so not too bad imo.
One slice of toast was good and the other was a little burnt.

The restaurant looked like it could hold about 70 people. There were only about 10 people in when I went. It also had a free book exchange (or at least that's what I'm assuming it was), so you can bring in a book that you finished reading and pick up a different one. They're only open from 7am to 3pm.

Overall, I'd say you get what you pay for. If you're looking for an exquisite breakfast, this is not the place to go to, however, if you're looking for something quick and cheap, then you'd regret not trying out this place.

Typically I don't write reviews lower than three stars. In this case they are just so close to doing it right. The staff just needs to be more attentive. It's frustrating to have to wave the empty coffee cup or water glass. The shopping mall they are in needs a major cleaning.

The Green and red chicken chilaquiles are amazing both spicey red is more spicey than the green. 
the fries made perfectly with a good crisp. the coffee is amazing, i love coffee in the am and this is awesome. 
thae waitresses for one are quite cute, and the staff all around are very friendly and come to your table often wnough to where u dont need to call them over. the best experience i have had a a diner in a long while. food great, coffee great waitress cheow! service #1, ten stars all around!

Often referred to as the neighborhood greasy spoon but I must offer up a better label.I love coming here for Sunday breakfast,  it just reminds me of my parents. Coffee is poured and poured and who doesn't want that.If you order a large omlet don't cry when you see how big it is.My girlfriend likes that egg whites are offered and so do I.50's music and vintage albums surround the room daddy - so grab your squeeze and cruise on in

I'd be willing to try it again, but I wasn't really that impressed. I guess I expected more out of a 4 1/2 star rating. 

The place wasn't that busy, the service was pretty friendly, can't complain there (for once!). 

The server wrote down my order wrong (minor thing, wrote spuds instead of fries - so I got the slices fried potatoes). When we pointed it out, however, her response was "he's so weird" in reference to the cook. Personally, unprofessional in my book. 

I still got an order of fries, so all was good. 

I ordered fish and chips. The serving wasn't huge, but was adequate for the price (under $10). My husband got a burger, said it was pretty good. 

I got the small order of onion rings as well, which appeared to be your typical frozen deep fried variety. 

The fish and chips were decent, but there was an odd, overly sweet taste. The tartar sauce was over sweet as well and it added up to a not so great meal. 

Again, I would go back, but I would simply steer clear of the fish and chips. 

As for the actual venue, it is need of some updating. The tables were peeling apart, and the decor is just dated. All in all, 3 stars because I would be willing to try something else on their menu.

Drove the extra mile to try this place out it was okay service was wonderful very friendly staff very friendly restaurant look very clean lots of people were there food was pretty average nothing spectacular but nothing too bad either.

This was my first experience at this diner and the food was great. The customer service was amazing. The prices were also very reasonable. There is a large selection on the menu.
I got the Mexican omelette. Very good and the portions are large.
The atmosphere is relaxed and clean. 
I have heard it is packed in the morning but I went around 3:30 p.m and there was only two people eating there so it was a quiet and enjoyable experience.  

This place looks shady and kinda like a hole in the wall, but give it a chance. I highly recommend.

We had a great experience here! Fantastic service, absolutely delicious vanilla drip coffee, delicious bread, yummy omelettes!  My daughter got a burger gluten free style with no bun and it was cheesy,  juicy and delicious!  Delicious milk shakes too! Big-time yummy there!  We will absolutely go back. Today was our first visit and we enjoyed every minute!

We are visiting from California and I came across this location! From the moment I got here we had great service! Definitely coming back when visiting! Definitely recommend the Meat Lovers Omelet ! Janette was our waitress and was really sweet and speedy service!

We were looking for someplace close to eat and found this gem. Excellent food. So many choices of omelette to choose from and you can always build your own if they don't have the combo you want. Everyone is friendly and welcoming. Definitely recommend.
The diner had a lot of options but mainly omelettes obviously because they are known for that.  The coffee was not good. The prices were reasonable so definitely worth the amount of food.

Great place to have a convenient and inexpensive breakfast. The staff here is very friendly and on top of it, especially the coffee lady who knows the best thing to say to me in the morning is "more coffee?" The service is usually quick can get in and out of here within 30 min if it's not too busy. I've never had a bad omelette here, I usually either get the special, the Portuguese with linguica sausage, or Loch Ness with shrimp and avocado. Definitely the best diner in the neighborhood.

I've been traveling across the country for 2 months and this place has the best breakfast I've had anywhere in the US thus far. The service is super friendly and you will never have a cold cup of coffee on your table. If your looking for a cheap and delicious place to grub off the strip. This is your spot.

We stopped in here for dinner on a weeknight recently. It's nothing special on the outside, but it's pretty cute on the inside. Lots of 50s themed decor. I believe they only recently started staying open for dinner. 

Hubs got a meatloaf sandwich and the spuds. Meatloaf sandwich was just ok and a little dry. Spuds were really, really good. 

I got a chicken, bacon, and avocado sandwich with fries. The sandwich was quite tasty but the fries were really blah. 

If we had had my sandwich with his spuds, it would have been great. 

I liked that it's a family-run joint. The food was just a little lacking though. And the waitress, as sweet as she was, was almost too sweet. She definitely seemed eager to please, but unfortunately that means certain customers will run right over someone like that...I saw a customer turn an entire plate of food away because he changed his mind....seriously. I felt bad for her, but she handled it well.
Pancakes were very good especially the sweet cream ones. Overall a little above average.  Fairly priced.  Would recommend.

Where do we start ...??? The food is amazing. Super homey feel and just fucking good. Lol. We find that most diner's are typically very good but we've now confirmed it. Pancakes were buttery and so fluffy. Bacon was nice and crispy. Coffee.... Give me more! The tuna sandwich was super yummy as well. Perfect combination of mayo and tuna. We are from L.A. so we've tried our fair share of breakfast places. If we come back to visit, this will definitely be our breakfast place. Service was super friendly and fast that we wanted to thank them for it. Seating outside made it possible for us to have breakfast with our fur babies.

Always friendly staff, serving comfort food for breakfast, lunch, and now dinner. Zucchini sticks are fresh made...one of favorite things to order as soon as we sit down, so they're usually serving them by the time we are ready to order. Meatloaf omelette or sandwich is always delicious. New York steak and eggs are a bargain at $9.99 (and the steaks they serve are good quality, not that cheap casino special kind). Go ahead and stop by for a good meal from a nice family owned restaurant, I'm sure they'll appreciate it.

Stopped in here on a whim after a workout. Best decision I made all month! Pick an omelet any omelette (2 t's?) I'm not sure, but I'm not here to talk about my spelling! Anywho, 3 egg omelets can be upgraded to 6 eggs for a dollar!!!!! That's 6 chickens!! The gravy on the biscuits was the best I have had besides my grandma's. Coffee was filled constantly without asking.  Our server Veronika was a delight she was attentive and had a smile on her face the entire time. The World Cup was on and there were some kids hanging out (8-10 years old) they all were very polite, respectful,  and responsible.  Come to find out one of them was Vero's so I see where they get it from!! I did not take a pic of the food because by the time I thought of it the plate was scraped clean. I will make this my once a month world omelet/omelette tour!! Keep up the great work guys!! OH!! Ps.. the crowd was from old to young various aray of ethnic backgrounds, people just starting thier day and people ending theirs... okay now I'm done
Place is great very friendly staff also very clean and organized. There's a lot of team work here

The fastest order to table breakfast I have had in years! I was shocked. 
Excellent service, again a trait that is in short supply.
The food was delicious portions were large. Neither my husband or myself could finish our meals.
Very 50's campy decor.
Will be back.

This place is bangin so says my son, lol.  We've been going here for years and we do love it for the main reason, the food is delicious!  Not only that, the prices are very affordable for what you get.  They have an amazing selection of omelets but we usually stick to the "popeye" and get the large so we have some to take home for the next morning.  The staff is always friendly and the service is very good.  The place is always clean including the restrooms.  It's our favorite place for breakfast!

Love this place, quick and friendly service and the food is delish. But the best part by far is the environment. It gives so much entertainment while you eat and you can tell it's a regular spot for a lot of people :)

We had the sweet cream pancakes and french toast.Food was great.Coffee not so great.Server could have been nicer.Took forever to get the check and pay.We will give it another try and hope for better service.

We had a great breakfast here - tried the egg & bacon special that came with pancakes - a great deal for the money with the best pancakes ever(sweet cream) - but you have three choices.  Then we tried the pumpkin bread and a buscuit and gravey side - both were exceptional.  I can't wait to go back.

Very good atmosphere.  Had a table of retired Special Forces group dining there this morning when we were there.  Thanks for your service gentlemen!
The food was very good.  I had the Cowboy omelet and it was served very quickly and was very good.  The other guest had a traditional pancake breakfast and it too, was good.  Price is right.

My family had breakfast here during a stay in Las Vegas, wanted to try a place off the strip so I found this place on yelp. 

Good prices and good breakfast omelettes

I did not care for the thin fried potatoes

Loved that it wasn't busy and it was family-friendly

Feeling gross
Just left this place after taking a sip of coffee and realizing there was lipstick caked on the mug.  So much I wiped my lips with my napkin and there was lipstick on that.    What topped it off was there was not even an apology.  Needless to say we left without ordering food.

Thought we would try this out one afternoon. I got the chicken fried steak and eggs and my fiancé got a blt. We both loved the food!! Prices were decent! I am a budget shopper. And our waitress was amazing!! We will definitely be visiting this place again!

Service- very nice women working today seemed pretty busy but we were seated right away. Really great for a Sunday breakfast
Food- was okay I was very interested in the chocolate chip pancakes and tried out the petunia pig omlet. Overall it was okay.

Well when I first walked in I liked the decorations made me feel like I went back in time. But the longer I sat at the table looking around the place I started noticing how dirty things were in this place. 

We sat at the table about 15 to 20 min before our server finally came and took our order. When the food finally came I was not impressed with it at all standard boring food. 

After I got home my tummy started to hurt come to find out I got food poisoning from this place I would never ever go here again and never ever recommend it.

We came for breakfast around noon. The pumpkin bread and jalapeno bacon were good but the stuffed blueberry french toast was very dry. The sausage patties were almost 100% fat. The coffee was not that good. Definitely 2-star in my book, not sure how this place has a 4-star average rating. Service was average but slow. Not coming back.

We were craving breakfast and wanted to try something new today. We walk in here and it's so cute and old fashioned. We sat ourselves and the waiter comes up to us and gets our drinks. She was really nice to us! I got the country fried steak and my man got the French toast. The French toast was so delicious. Amazing flavor! It came with two eggs and sausage or bacon (he picked sausage)! Perfect over easy eggs! My country fried steak was sooo good. Better than usual. Most of the time it lacks salt at other places, but here it was perfect! Not too salty but just right! It came with spuds and eggs as well. We also got an amazing Oreo milkshake and I got a Coke as well. All that was $27! It's really fairly priced. Come here!

We would definitely become regulars here!!  Blueberry and cream cheese stuffed French toast, pancakes and omelette were outstanding. The spuds can be missed. The wait staff great. The biscuit and gravy to die for. The sausage tastes home made.

I wish this place was closer!  No pretensions, just good comfort food in comfortable booths in yes, comfortable pink walls dotted with vintage posters.  My son and I were greeted with smiles and 50s beach music.  I'm all fuzzy inside.  

There really was nothing to fault between the iced coffee and pulpy OJ, to the bacon and soft spud chips (you can order them crisp) to the warm and efficient service.  I really enjoyed the hint of parsley seasoning on the chips and the sweet cream pancakes are GOOD.  So far, the best in Vegas in my book (I enjoyed them more than Du-par's too).  Fluffy and tasty with whipped salty butter and syrup that is a little runny but still good. 

We'll be back to try the other menu items, especially the apple pie ala mode!

This is a late review but we had breakfast here on my birthday during our Las Vegas trip in June 2016.  and WOW it was all I was looking for. I wanted a good hometown diner breakfast big and everything included and boy did I ever get it.  I ordered an eggs benedict and man was it over the top. Everything was cooked to perfection.  I was so stuffed when I left and we spent almost nothing at this place! So great, hit the spot!  My only regret was not making it back prior to our leaving Las Vegas

This place is not far from my house and I've driven by it for years and never went in.  One of my friends told me how good it was so I went with here there.  Their breakfasts are really good.  I didn't like the chips served with the eggs, but next time I'll just get the home fries.  The Decor is very 50's, the staff were friendly and the service was top notch.  I agree with the person that said the place could use a good cleaning, but it would not stop me from recommending the food.

Typical diner food: excessively salty, carb-y, and popular with the old folks. The only positives were the price and quick service... except for our toast, which didn't come out until we were almost done eating.

I had an avocado, cheese and tomato omelette with the chips and my boyfriend had the chicken fried steak. It was nice that I could choose between a 3 egg and a 6 egg omelette since eggs aren't the kind of thing you want to haul around in a doggy bag. The chips were good, if a little salty and soggy at parts.

I'd recommend this place if you want to detox your wallet after a night on the strip and don't mind filling your stomach with salty carbs.
Good food.  Good prices.  Nice staff and good service.  I had the corn  beef hash with eggs easy over.  The ambience is 50s.  All in all a good breakfast for the price.
I thought this place would be worth checking out because it's different. The food was average.

We had a really great breakfast there this morning. Delicious omelets and chicken fried steak. That jalapeno bacon was spicy but quite tasty. 

Service was speedy and friendly. 

We'll go again.

We were on this side of town lookin for a good place to eat. Went straight to yelp as I always do & came across this cute little 50s diner. 

Decor inside is pretty neat. The walls are pink, there's a juke box there (don't know if it works, paintings & pictures that's 50s related. Very cute.

Variety on the menu. I decided to get the Mexican omelet. You get to choose if you want 3 or 6 eggs. Of course I picked the 3 lol. I decided to substitute the toast for biscuits and gravy. That was a good decision. They also have home made potato chips that comes with the meal which was surprisingly pretty good. 

Beau got the French toast special. Didn't really try it but he said it was really good. Comes with eggs and sausage or bacon. 

Good breakfast place to go to if your in the area! Our waitress was great too. She only came by to check on us once or twice though but we really didn't need anything.

The severs were friendly and attentive and the food came quickly  They have a nice selection of omelets.. I had a shrimp omelet with spinach and cheddar cheese, and hash browns and both were very tasty. Great breakfast spot. Give it a try
Mexican omelette was amazing!! Pancakes were delicious, banana bread was a little dry but still yummy. Service was good as well.

Just took my niece here & it was good, prices right & the chicken strips and shakes were delicious! 
Service was excellent, everyone checks in on you & is happy; rare in Las Vegas local spots, it was really a nice change!
Thank you & we will be back!
Quaint place to eat. We enjoyed the sandwiches and the music! The onion soup was good, although on the sweet side. Never had sweet onion soup before.
This restaurant was really fun. There's piles and piles of happy families in here having the time of her life. Very good food. Very clean, wonderful staff.

If I could give this place no stars I would! This is the worst food I've ever had. The steak was cooked on one side and raw on the other... Fried potatoes were chips and my eggs were supposed to be over medium and the yolk was fully cooked not to mention, my husband ordered sausage and it was fried hotdogs.  I will never eat this garbage again and we paid. over $30 for 2 people to eat breakfast.
Will go again when in Vegas. We really enjoyed the breakfast. Wish I could leave a video cause a have a cute one with the pumpkin bread. MMMMmm
This place was excellent! Great price and service. No crowd and great food. Definitely coming back.

Nothing fancy...good omlet, very reasonable prices.
I have only been once...willing to try it again.

Went back....everything was satisfactory.
Nice.

Service is excellent...very friendly.

So sad to say but this place just did not cut it for me. We were able to sit anywhere and our waitress brought some menus out to us and waters. The menu definitely needed to be wiped down. I could feel a layer of food build up ackk. The water cups were also a little on the dingy side. However, our waitress was friendly and made sure to check up on us frequently. 
I ordered the Petunia Pig omelet adding avocado and my boyfriend ordered the Pilgrim turkey sandwich and replaced fries with hashbrowns. Everything on my order was overcooked but everything my boyfriend had and everyone around me had normal cooked food.  The toast and spuds that came with mine were very black on the edges, extremely stale and not warm  like it had been sitting out for a while. My omelet was also very rubbery and on the cold side. My boyfriend's sandwich and hashbrowns were warm and fresh tasting. I was thinking about giving them a second chance but how can you send out two things to the same table where the quality of one is definitely lacking. So no thanks, very disappointed.
The omlets awesome. Coffee is the best tasting I have had at a breakfast place and my fiance loves the hot chocolate. The staff is very friendly and is quick on the refills.

Super delicious! My family& I went for dinner& we all loved our food. It's a nice, clean, comfy environment. Great service. Reasonably priced. Felt like a home cooked meal. &&I love the oldies music playing in the background, rather than the annoying pop music playing in most restaurants. We plan to go there for family dinner regularly.

Here from Maryland looking for a more local breakfast place to eat at. Was so delicious I recommend the stuffed French toast ... this food could not get any better! I wish I could give them 100 stars we will be back when we come back to Vegas !
Well breakfast is breakfast. Pancakes were pretty damn good but the Friendly and Efficient Staff is worth coming back for.
This is a super cute themed diner that is a little off the beaten path from the strip. The food was good and the prices very reasonable. I had the Portuguese omelet which was good.

My husband and I came here on a Sunday morning. It was busy, but we got seated pretty quickly. The food was typical diner stuff, but nothing really exceptional. It was tasty, though. Service was decent. The decor is eclectic diner style, but I liked it. Prices are ok and the people were nice overall. 4 stars because service was a little slow and I felt we should have been attended to a little better.

I've been here a couple of times but never for breakfast. The service and food is very good, the location not so good. But it's one of the few good places in this dumpy side of town. My colleague for the Mexican omelet and was raving about it. I got a tasty patty melt. It's also cheap!

Been eyeballing this place since we came to town in 1991. Today in 2016 we finally made it in there. The menu is terrific. Prices seems like everywhere else. The servers were great at checking up on us and were kind. For what my husband and I ordered, I just wasn't visually pleased and it seemed like too much grease. We are going to try one more time though and a different selection of food. Sorry but I give a low rating this time.

Pretty bland food. Eggs Benedict came with fried eggs instead of poached and what looked like luncheon meat instead of canadian bacon. Chili is very boring with no heat at all. did very much like the biscuits and gravy. the staff was nice and everything was smooth, bathroom was very clean.

Just before flying back to France, I took my breakfast here. The place is nicely decorated, waitresses were real kind and smiling. Food was good and coffee are free refilled.
I'll come back asap.

I've read really good reviews on this place and today (Mother's Day) I decided to bring my sisters for breakfast! Loved the theme "50's" also enjoyed the fact that oldies were playing as background music! It was a little too crowed but service was great and very attentive! They also have a sign that reads "the friendliest diner" very true! Our server was very attentive and quick! Thumbs up! So I ordered the short stack pancakes "wheat" these pancakes were soo fluffy and full of flavor! Sucked I couldn't finish them but I'd definitely be back as there is more to choose from! It's super affordable very great food and service!

I love this place! Full of Elvis, Rat Pack and Marilyn Monroe pictures and kitschy 50's memorabilia. It's a small piece of old vegas. The food is good, portions are large and the prices are reasonable! Definitely recommend this place.
I like it there it family owned and everybody is great there the bacon is so thick the spuds are the best a must try place great for local..

We stopped in for dinner before heading to Fremont Street. It's what it says it is a Diner. It wasn't great but it wasn't bad either. Prompt friendly service is always nice. I would like to stop again and try Breakfast.

This place was amazing, their fried zucchini as an appetizer was fantastic. I'm a picky water and don't eat zucchini, I'm more of a yellow squash person, I would get it again.  I was mainly here to try their $4.99 French toast (4 wedges).  It came out just how it should be, hot! Perfectly golden brown, and plenty of powered sugar. Big helping of butter.

Very cheap breakfast specials. I can see coming here again. For a Wednesday at 1 PM ( after lunch rush) it was quiet, maybe 6 tables including us.
Wow yum!! Don't let the outside turn you away. Such a good breakfast and super cheap. All the servers were good!
I have been coming to this place for the last few years and the omelets are out of this world. The staff is always nice and I like the music they play while you are at the diner
This is just one of those great places to go out and have a nice breakfast. At a very low cost. Quality food large portions and great service. You cannot go wrong with this restaurant.

Stopped here for breakfast on our way out from Vegas and although at the beginnig the service was kind of weird, our server was great once she showed up : P
We were seated and waiting for a while..
The food was good, reasonably priced, good portions, etc.
All qualities I appreciate at a breakfast place.

I had the chicken fried steak with eggs, and the pumpkin bread instead of toast.
The pumpkin bread was almost dessert on its own.

Overall great experience, we hope to be back.

Another great breakfast here!!!  Fast, friendly and yummy food!  I've been here a few times for breakfast and it's been bomb everytime!  Their breakfast potatoes are thin chips.  Country breakfast plate is the BEST!!!!

This little place is absolutely amazing.  The food is fantastic.  Great customer service! We will definitely return. Chicken chillaquilles were perfect! The little potato chips that come with chicken fried steak are phenomenal!

Great place. Went for lunch today and the prices are great too.  My daughter and I both had to make some tough choices, as they have quite a selection on their extensive menu.   We ended up both getting burger plates, and they were awesome, old-fashioned diner style delicious burgers!   We will definitely be going back!
Cute, good food, and cheap prices. Its nice to eat off the Strip sometimes. :o)

This business is family owned and operated. I love supporting them because they have really good food. There are always specials on the board. The menu is extensive. Breakfast is busy on the weekends but there is lots of seating. 

PROS: Farmer Juan's omelet
            Big portions
            Family operated
            A working jukebox
            Great prices

CONS: Sometimes on the weekends there is a line for breakfast

This little diner is THE best kept secret in town! Discovered it in our neighborhood about 2 years ago and eat here at least once a week. The warm and friendly staff know us and treat us like family. Favorite menu items: Their homemade Chicken Vegetable soup is THE BEST! Also enjoy their omelettes, tuna melts, tuna sandwich, patty melts, and philly cheesesteaks! (Oh, and try their jalapeno bacon! Yum!)

I went strictly by the fellow Yelpers reviews and I wasn't disappointed. It's a total local hole in the wall. The service was friendly and the food was so good.

The quality and taste was fantastic. Im sure we will come back.

FYI they are on restaurants.com for the budget minded.

Give them a try.

I enjoyed the pancakes, (buttermilk), and the peanut butter milk shake.  The decor is kind of fun, I like the poster of Marilyn Monroe lifting weights haha.  There's a cool jukebox but I dont think customers can put money in and play it, but it's nice.  You just seat yourself, and eventually the waitress comes around. It was pretty busy so you might need to flag someone down whenever you need something, but our experience was good and friendly.

the best diner so far! i live the food and the atmosphere! people are awesome there. i must say its a hidden gem in vegas! price is very reasonable. calm quite neigbourhood and a perfect beginning of a day! i will go back there tomorrow again!

This place is ok. I love breakfast and there are much better places around town to go to. 
Nothing spectacular here but people seemed to enjoy it.

Price is right for breakfast. I particularly enjoy the two egg breakfast(simple enough) with hash browns  make sure you request them otherwise you get these chip things. I as well have one other pet peeve here in that they do not butter the toast....Friendly staff and the atmosphere is as you would ask for...

Food was  but as an African American, I felt intimidated by this place. The name throws me off, but I gave it a try. There's no culture for my kind on the wall, that or I missed it. I feel like the 50s was a big deal for blacks.

I do a bunch of restaurant sampling now that I am retired as a hobby. This place is close and had decent reviews so I gave it a shot... the staff was friendly and helpful. I had eggs, bacon and hash browns. All was very tasty. One strange thing that I have never come across... if you don't go with their std potatoes, they charged like 90 cents extra for the hash browns ....
Love this place. Food, service, atmosphere, prices:  all the best, all the time.  There is nothing else in town that even comes close to this authentic diner experience.

This is a great family owned diner. It feels very authentic to what a diner should feel and taste like. The food was good and the service was great. The food was fresh and tasty. Their portion sizes are big. Defiantly a place you should go to hungry but if your not you can always take it to go. Prices a super reasonable too. My favorite was the chocolate shake.

More like 3.5 stars but id rather give an extra .5 for a locally owned place than take it away. 

Hubby & i have been coming here for years. Its a dive for sure, with kitchy 50s decor that looks like it may have been here since the 50s, but i like that sort of thing. They even have a jukebox playing oldies :)

The service is usually friendly, the food is ok but nothing to write home about. Its decent though, fills your belly, and is relatively cheap. 

Kids meals are only $2.65 each, and theyll give you coloring pages if you ask. Its a very casual atmosphere that makes me & my gang of kids feel welcome. 

Bigger portions, Lots of choices & they accomodate substitutions with no problem. Try the homemade pumpkin nut bread, also the homemade "chips". 

Theres a reason we come here several times a month. Maybe a 4 stars after all :)

I had the open face hot roast beef sandwich. The roast beef tasted like it had been heated on the flat top grill. It gave the roast beef a nice additional flavor. The fries were hot and crispy.

Only 2 complaints. The place smelled lightly of Clorox. Not the worst smell as it did smell clean. The fries had a really good texture but tasted slightly of onions, like they had been cooked in the same oil as onion rings.  Next time I'll try a different side.

Overall the food and service were good and I'll definitely be back.

I have been going to the 50s diner since I was like 8. I love it here. the food is always good, the service is speedy. the waitresses are super nice and it's a family business so it's always the same faces. It's one of my fave places to go for breakfast. I prefer this place over ihop any day. forever good service and overall a really nice environment.  not many mom and pop diners here in Vegas so I really appreciate this place!

YELP 365 CHALLENGE 2014-(339/365) "Short Stack Of Awesomeness!"

We made our way back to the friendliest diner around since I haven't had a plate of Awesomeness(AKA their Sweet Cream Pancakes) in a while. We were fortunate to have Veronika wait on us again which is always great because just her interaction with customers whether they are regulars or first time customers is some of the best service you'll ever have. Seriously.

We both split  a Breakfast Sandwich Special which came with spuds(their potato chips which you can request soggy or crispy) and a two pancake special(Your choice of Buttermilk or Sweet Cream) which also came with two eggs and either a sausage patty or two strips of bacon. At this point, I couldn't decide between sausage or bacon, so  Veronika suggested some Jalapeno Bacon which they also serve in their omelettes and sandwiches and I was sold! Everything was delicious as always, and we were fueled up to start our day.

It's great to see that this place is constantly packed and that this family owned business is doing well. Another thing I've noticed is that they now have a lunch and dinner menu, and that they are open until later(I believe I saw 7 am-9 pm Monday-Saturday, and Sundays only, 7 am-3 pm) but I wasn't too sure, so you may want to call to confirm.  ALOHA!!!

Shaka Meter:  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  5

It has been over 2 months since I have eaten here. I had the same omelet I always eat #36 egg whites only, grilled chicken, sausage,  zucchini, spinach, avacado inside and Jack cheese.  Todays new addition was a side of Spanish sauce that I dumped on top.  All I have to say is WOW, this sauce is amazing.  I have now tried it on the following: fries, burger, hot dog and the California chicken sandwich.  This stuff is phenomenal and ridiculously addictive.
This is the kind of place I love fining when I travel. This a mom and pop diner, home made food, fresh and very friendly. The prices are unreal and they are open from 7am to 11pm.... Great finding!!

The diner is becoming my favorite eating places. It has a comfortable atmosphere and the food has always been good at a reasonable price. The waitress staff always have smiles on their faces and make you feel welcome. I have recommended it to quite a few of my friends.

Thought we would try the 50s Diner for breakfast. Frankly, it was nothing more than the proverbial 'greasy spoon'. The coffee was terrible; the omelets were small and came with a helping of greasy potato chips. 
Wait staff was friendly and happy.

I'm a big breakfast person so finding this cute diner was a delight especially it being just a few minutes away from where I live. The service is always prompt and very friendly - always a plus in my book. I've had a few stuff in their menu but my favorite is the "Rio Grande Surfer" Omelette with spuds. I also get their pumpkin nut bread with any meal I get coz it's just freaking amazing! Their pancakes are also good and fluffy -definitely a must try. If ever you are around the area do not hesitate to try this place out.
buttermilk pancake was a little thick.  Service good and fast. Coffee was good. Nice looking 50s diner. Whoever the snooty snob it was that said it didn't look good on the outside where are you from.

This place is a little hidden gem! It's family owned and the food is great! 
Definitely have to try an omelette with the spuds.
Been eating here for 10 plus years, never a bad meal or service. I think we have had every omelet on the menu by now. Love this place, never go anywhere else for breakfast really
Mexican omelet- the best omelet I've ever had. Great bacon, awesome potato slice/chip/hash brown things! Fast and friendly.
I'm so glad this diner is right down the street from my house! They have amazing food at reasonable prices. Huge selection of omelettes and even the "small" ones are big enough.

I went for lunch on 8/4/2014.  I entered and the restaurant was busy with a lot of tables and booths full, although there were still a couple of tables open, I  decided to sit at the counter. I was immediately given a menu by a friendly waitress with a smile on her face.  I ordered the dinner chicken fried  steak but  it was called by a different name.  It came with two sides and I chose a salad and mashed potatoes.  The salad was nothing great and I would call it average.  I was given two packets of crackers, no butter, and I was not asked if I needed anything else.  The silverware was set on the counter with no napkin and I was surprised because I had no idea if it was clean or  if it had been cleaned and I pulled some napkins out of the napkin holder, wiped the fork and knife clean and set it on a napkin.  Just as I finished the salad my "chicken fried steak" was served and it was plain and simple.  Breaded steak patty with "mashed potatoes" covered in a gravy that was probably the best part of the meal.  It had small pieces of meat, but  I couldn't tell if it was sausage or hamburger, and I thought that was odd,  because I am a gravy man.  The mashed potato had what appeared  more flour than I was used to, and it stuck together oddly, like it might have been from a baked potato that had been mashed to make mashed potatoes.  The steak patty was breaded and the coating fell off the patty before I could cut it.  It must have been frozen and did not adhere to the patty when cooked.  I did eat the whole thing as I'm not one to let any Chicken Fried Steak go to waste, but I would not order this item again.  I was not asked if I needed anything while eating either the salad or the steak, even though, I was sitting at the counter and all the servers had to do was turn around while in the area and ask.  It may have been that I ordered a dinner item  for lunch,  but it lacked, anything special  that would make me return and have another.  To be fair, I'll stop in again and order breakfast, or another meal and give them a second chance, because even the best places can mess up on occasion.  My meal/with drink came to $12.99 and it was not as good as a Chicken Fried Steak, I would have gotten at the Longhorn Casino for half the price, with eggs on the side.
Very good. Nice hot plate. Can't complain. Burgers are meaty and their bacon is amazing. Fast service. I enjoyed myself and so did my taste buds.

Our first meal in Las Vegas! We chose this diner based on solely what Yelp users have said! They were so right! The food was great and portions were huge. The waiter kept refilling our coffee and we didn't have to wait long for our food. Banana bread was good, although the pumpkin nut bread tasted more like a spice bread. I wouldn't get that again. We all had omelets(which I have never seen such a selection)

Wow this has been one of the best eggs benedict  I have ever had. I have the eggs Benedict Florentine and it was made perfectly not overcooked and the hollandaise sauce was incredible. I highly recommend this place and really hope to return.
Great service and huge omelets! I had three Portuguese and it was amazing! The prices are great, the staff very friendly and, quick.

If you want some place that is fun and don't have rush for food this Is a great little place to visit. Everything was nice only thing that lowered it to 4 stars was the wait to have our drinks and that we had no flatware. The food was good, the waitresses as busy as they were did their best to remain friendly and as attentive as possible. 

Price for the food is worth it and you are given a good hot portioned plate.

The food is great and the service is also amazing. I highly recommend the freshly made pumpkin nut bread and their spuds! They're constantly offering coupons and good deals if you sign up for the emailing club. Great little diner to have some breakfast in the morning or afternoon.
Had some breakfast here today... Boyfriend and I had omelettes (I had the rio grande yummy chorizo!!) Was really impressed all around

Great food, great service! Want real home style cooking, come here...it's delicious! Family ordered stuffed blueberry French toast, 2 pancake special, biscuit & gravy platter & egg sandwich....all perfect to start the day. Veronika was really friendly (our waitress).

I was on my way from an appointment to UNLV and decided to have some breakfast at this long bookmarked restaurant.

Seating myself at the counter, I was asked immediately if I wanted coffee.  That's always a good sign.  I looked at the menu and at the specials board and I opted for one of the specials, the Dream omelette.  It's described as a small omelette filled with ham, onions, and garlic covered with a feta sauce and served with avocado and hash brown potatoes.

The wait was a normal time and I enjoyed looking at all the memorabilia from the 50s and 60s whether photos of classic Las Vegas places and entertainers or another wall that had 33 1/3 album covers from music of the period.

The omelette was delivered and it was good.  I didn't taste the garlic but the feta cheese sauce was good.  Serving the avocado on a separate plate was a good idea so everything didn't get mushed together on one dish.

Service was very good.  My coffee was refilled often. 

A nice stop for a filling and tasty breakfast before continuing on my way.
This place is way better than Denny's or IHOP. Prices are reasonable, fast and friendly service and their portions are huge. Awesome place !

Not anywhere as good as the original.. not friendly and my food was left on the counter not being keep warm...omelette in pieces...Potatoes hard and tasted like old oil zero salt.. what a disappointment...go to the original if you really want the true experience of The Omelet House... they should take their name back from the 50s Diner it's not a good representation
Excellent food! Found this on yelp and it is as good as everyone says! Was playing at boulder station and this was just down the street. Ordered breakfast at 8 pm and it was fresh and delicious.
Nice Mom & Pop restaurant to dine at good food quick service...Will be dinning here again

It's a typical 50s styled breakfast diner. It has a homey feel about it. My husband got the Mexican omelet which he said was super delicious. I got chocolate chip pancakes (which were burnt) and hash browns (which were too hard to eat). So if you're coming stick to the omelets I guess. It's decently priced though.

I was pretty excited to try this place which made me even more disappointed for the visit today. 

First, the place is as filthy inside as it is outside. Food and trash all over the floor. They probably don't sweep until close every day. If you are a germ freak..RUN! The bathrooms were even worse. The menus don't get wiped down, neither do any of the condiments at the table. 

Second, the service was terrible. We placed out order and I had to ask for pumpkin bread 3 times during my visit before I received it. No one came to check on us. I had to fight to get half and half for my coffee. 

Third, the food. We order the pancake special and the 2 egg special. The pancakes were decent but nothing tasted fresh like you would expect from a diner. When I finally got that pumpkin bread I was fighting to get it was terrible. 

If this is what diners were like in the 50s than I would have hated the 50s. I don't expect 5 star service or environment but I felt uncomfortable just sitting in this filthy place.

This place was pretty cute. Idk if I consider this place a hole in the wall, but it was still cute. I also don't know much about the 50's so idk how accurate the decor is. They had posters of Elvis and Marilyn Monroe On the walls. 

The main reason I liked this place was that it had an actual diner feel. When people in Vegas think of a diner they think of Denny's. They have the wait staff right on the front of the menu. They're all nice. I do wish they wore like a 50's themed servers outfit but oh well lol.

I had their smothered steak with garlic bread that came with 2 sides for $12. I chose their soup of the day and their spuds. It was cream of mushroom and the chips they have shown on everyone's photos.  The soup was good, nothing special. I do like their spuds. They're like home made potato chips. They're delicious. If they seasoned them they would definitely be special to me and something I would crave and return often for.

The steak came "smothered" in mushrooms and grilled onions. My food was okay. I don't expect much when it comes to steak at a place like this but my steak sucked. I'm so sad to say! I assumed they'd be hesitant to do a medium well and serve it pink so I went with medium and it was gray/brown in the middle. It was disappointing. I didn't send it back I just drowned it in A1 but steak really shouldn't NEED that. Also their really should have been a sauce if it were smothered. I should have known to get something easier to not mess up like chicken fingers.

Anyways I also had coffee and their 50's platter. The coffee was great and definitely refilled plenty. The platter was an appetizer sampler and was a big portion for 7.99. It came with two chicken fingers, two fish planks, zucchini fries, and onion rings. Everything was tasty. 

Overall I enjoyed my visit. I do like the waitresses. The food was decent. The prices were fair. Won't break the bank but not super cheap. For three people who shared an appetizer, 3 coffees, and three "entrees" we spent $40.

Would I return? Yes. I'd want to try their desserts like apple pie to see if they're home made. 

I would try one of their omelettes as they have a whole page of em! They also have all of the classic diner items you'd expect like biscuits and gravy, breakfast items, steak and eggs, and eggs Benedict.

This is going to be my new "go-to" for early morning breakfast before work!

This place has a great vibe, very laid back and exactly how I picture a diner in the 50's would look like. Both times I've been here I have had super prompt service and the food has hit the spot!

The only thing stopping me from throwing in that extra star is that their hash browns are really potato chips, and their bacon was so spicy my eyes were watering and my nose running!

Now with that being said I know some people might really like those two things, my fiance is definitely a fan, and if that's something you're into than this place is definitely going to be a five star experience for you!

Good for the price! We were the only ones eating there who weren't locals, which is always a good sign. Service was on point, food was hot and fresh, and the environment was fun. Our server was very attentive and great. We would likely go back if we were in town again!
Great breakfasts.  This place is probably my favorite local spot for eggs benedict.  The warm pumpkin nut bread is a must.

Overrated with much room for improvement.

Pros: The service was nice and the malt was good.
Cons: breakfast eggs were cold, the spuds are just homemade chips (some soggy),  the burger meat is low grade, and the chili-cheese fries were the worst.  They were just some soggy fries with a scoop of cheese and chili thrown on them in the messiest presentation ever.  I've been to a few 50s diners before and this one doesn't compare  Other diners are normally cleaner and present themselves with more than just posters of Elvis and Marilyn Monroe.
Where's Buddy Holly, Chuck Berry, Jerry Lee Lewis and all the others?

Omg, this place is so amazing! The waitresses and staff are always so inviting, and warm! The food is also really great. I usually come in for Breakfast. "The Mexican" omelet Is my absolute fave!! Don't even get me started on the spuds! Friggin' delicious!! Lunch is also really good. Usually if I go there for lunch I get the "Turkey Club" or the, "Big Daddy Wamo". 50's Diner is without a doubt, one of the best spots around. Fuck IHOP and Denny's.

I give it top score for following reasons:

1. Friendly staff, was greeted promptly as soon as we walked in
2. Good crowd of patrons, looks like a local spot everyone enjoys
3. Server Angie was very friendly and helped answer any questions even brought out samples of the homemade "spuds" since it was our first time. Homemade potatoe slices w seasoning. 
4. Food: NY Steak and Eggs, Patty Melt, BLT
       All was excellent in my opinion. I'm no food critic but tasty no complaints. 
5. Sundae: can't go wrong with sundae at a 50's diner :)

I've been eyeing this place for a while now, and I finally resolved to try it today. I'm glad I did.

There's some wordage outside saying that this is Omelet House 50's Diner. One of the employees mentioned that they used to be owned by Omelet House a long time ago, and it really shows in the menu. All those omelets are pretty much the same, and there's plenty of other typical diner options for breakfast and lunch.

I was being a little budget-minded. I was sad that the "early bird" 1/2 sandwich and soup special advertised outside (~$5) was only available starting at 2 (and going until 6?) so I went for the two egg breakfast special instead (available all day for $4.99) with spuds, bacon, my choice of scrambled eggs, and a $0.89 substitution of the pumpkin nut bread for the toast.

That pumpkin nut bread was probably my favorite thing, with a rich flavor complemented by my liberal addition of butter and the sweetness of the baked-in raisins. The eggs were moist, the bacon was good if a little modestly sized. The spuds were very similar to what I've had at Omelet House, and they're basically really thick chips. Would've liked if they were all somewhat crunchy, but some were chewy and some were a bit overdone.

Really though, none of the menu options really will break the bank. It's solid American Food with a retro feel, including the music. I'll have to try it again some time. I think it's a good alternative for lunch in the area if you ever want a change of pace from Thai Food To Go.

Stopped by for a late lunch, and had the chicken fried steak dinner entrée, mashed potatoes & coleslaw. The food was very tasty.  The gravy was sausage gravy, which I though was unusual. The mashed potatoes were fresh made. The slaw was very lightly dressed.  A really good value.

Great little get to get away from the strip. Breakfast was awesome. I had to try the jalepeno bacon. The Portuguese sausage omelette was delicious and the pumpkin bread was fresh and delicious. Highly recommend!!
The corned beefwas great if you like that old school 50's Hormel canned taste. The restaurant was dirty and service was slow.

By far, the best breakfast place I ate in Las Vegas.
I ad a vegetable omelette I created with bacon, spuds(awesome) & sourdough toast (rarely offered elsewhere).  I'm a 50's music lover & those tunes only enhanced the atmosphere along with the pictures. What a perfect breakfast!!

This was an excellent breakfast. Hubby was hangry, and not quite sure about my decision to try out this place. After a quick look through Yelp, we decided this was our choice for Sunday breakfast. 

The place was busy at 9am, but there were a few booths available, and we quickly found one in a corner by the window. It is 'seat yourself' here, and menus were already on the table. We split an order, as we always do, and this time it was the Mexican Omelet. This has tomatoes, onion, jalapeño, jack cheese, avocado, side of salsa and topped with sour cream and a slice of jalapeno bacon. To this we added sausage inside of the omelet. Oh, and because Nelson Q said that it is a must to order their Sweet Cream Pancakes, we ordered one to share as well. 

It was a nice surprise when we received our breakfast already split onto to plates, and each of us got a slice of spicy bacon. There was a generous amount of avocado in this omelet, and that bacon has a bite! The spice sneaks up on you, but it is wonderful. 
And Nelson Q...THANK YOU!!! I almost took the entire sweet cream pancake for myself. It was so good that I didn't even use the syrup. My husband, who does not eat pancakes, loved it. He kept going back for another bite. 

We are both so glad that we tried this breakfast location. The staff was very nice, and the food arrived promptly at our table. We enjoyed the 50s music playing as well. It was a really comfortable place to eat. The food quality is simply awesome.
This dinner was clean. My order was out on time and was hot and fresh. The waiters were very friendly, and the restaurant was warm and quiet. Strongly recommended!

So I found this place of rest front.com I order the coupon Sigurd what do I have to lose have to lose. So it's selfDefeating which I actually like so I can choose the area of the restaurant I like.
